page.title: 11JOHN LEWIS GAMEKEEPER (cont)
page.content:
{JOHN LEWIS (Part 5)
and John Lewis trains a school leaver every year.Being a gamekeeper means being on call 24 hours a day.All the keepers have a C.B.radio (15 miles radius) so that they can call for help or be contacted if there is a problem. One of the main problems is from poaching.Gangs of poachers can steal 200-300 pheasants in one night.John Lewis has been attacked several times by poachers and has even ended up in hospital.His car has also been damaged.Gamekeepers can only cosh after dark-they are very brave men. John was recently interveiwed on Radio 4 about his work.Before John Lewis became the gamekeeper for Balcombe Estate in 1960,the job was done for ten years by his father,Jack.Jack was a gamekeeper for fifty years and has..
